conclusion: Given: B1 = 2B2, q, m, B1, B2.
The particle enters the magnetic field B1 perpendicularly to MN at point O.
The magnetic field B1 is twice the magnitude of the magnetic field B2.
The particle will experience a force due to the magnetic field, given by F = qvB.
The particle will move in a circular path due to the magnetic force.
The radius of the circular path is given by r = mv/qB.
The time period of the circular motion is T = 2πr/v = 2πm/qB.
Since the particle passes through point O downward again, it completes half a cycle: t = T/2 = πm/qB.
Substitute B1 with 2B2 in the time equation: t = πm/(q(2B2)) = πm/(2qB2).
The particle will pass through point O downward again after a time of πm/(2qB2).
